intro: Miricacalia makineana, commonly known as the Makinean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Miricacalia makineana is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
